A Step-By-Step Guide to Canada Start-Up Visa from India

Do you have an innovative business idea? Talented entrepreneurs can immigrate through Canada Start-up Visa from India. Learn more in this comprehensive guide to Canadian Permanent residence through SUV Program from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]The Canada Startup Visa program is a special immigration program that allows qualified foreign entrepreneurs to settle in Canada and set up a startup business. This program was launched on March 31st, 2018 as a three-year program. It has since been made a permanent part of Canada’s immigration programs. The Startup Visa Program offers a great alternative for Indian entrepreneurs who have an innovative business idea that can compete on a global scale and contribute to the Canadian economy and generate employment for the local people.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”top” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”What is Canada’s Start-Up Visa?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664879628966{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]The Startup Visa Canada program is a one-of-a-kind program that caters to foreign entrepreneurs with a startup business proposal. Indian entrepreneurs who qualify for this program can enter Canada and settle after establishing their start-ups there.

If you want to apply for Canada Start-Up Visa from India you must know that it tends to be highly selective. The Canadian Government’s goal is to attract entrepreneurs that will contribute greatly to Canada’s economy.

It is a great choice for business owners who do not qualify for the Federal Skilled Worker program or the other Provincial Nominee Programs (PNPs).[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”3/5″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Eligibility Requirements for Canada Start-Up Visa from India” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1669384906325{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878451624{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]To apply for the Canada Startup Visa program, Indian entrepreneurs must meet the following eligibility requirements:

  • You must have a qualifying business
  • You must obtain a valid letter of support from a designated organization
  • You must meet minimum language requirements
  • You need to show enough proof of funds to live in Canada
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”default” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”1. You Must Have a Qualifying Business”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664824900693{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The Canada Start-Up Visa applicant must start a qualifying business to be eligible. Additionally, the applicant must hold 10% or more of the business’s voting rights associated with its shares. If multiple applicants apply for the Canada Start-Up Visa from India, they must hold more than 50% of the voting rights combined.

In addition to meeting the above requirements, applicants must:

  • Be involved with actively managing the business from inside Canada.
  • Ensure a vital component of business operations is conducted in Canada.
  • Ensure the business is incorporated within Canada.
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”2. You Must Obtain a Valid Letter of Support from an Organization”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664826931546{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]

Applicants must possess a valid letter of support via a designated organization. These organizations include venture capital funds, angel investor groups, and business incubators. Each of these organizations possesses different requirements. Therefore, applicants may need to pitch their business proposals to each one accordingly.

The minimum requirement investment required from each designated organization is shown below:

  • Venture capital funds: $200,000
  • Angel investor groups: $75,000
  • Business incubators: No requirement as long as the applicant is accepted into the Canadian business incubator’s program.

Indian entrepreneurs can learn more about the importance of creating a great business plan for applying for business immigration here. If successful, the designated organization will provide the applicant with a letter of support. This letter must then be included along with the Canada Startup Visa application.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Accent-Color” title=”3. You Must Meet Minimum Language Requirements”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664820369561{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]

Indian entrepreneurs must also possess the ability to communicate fluently in English and/or French to succeed in Canada. To meet this requirement, applicants must demonstrate their language skills by taking a language test from an agency approved by the Canadian immigration department i.e., Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada.

This test assesses applicants on their language skills in:

  • Reading
  • Writing
  • Speaking
  • Listening

To be eligible for this Canada Startup Visa program, applicants must achieve a Canadian Language Benchmark 5 or higher on their test. All applicants must ensure they are fluent in English and/or French before applying for the Startup Visa program.

[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Accent-Color” title=”4. You Need to Show Proof of Funds to Settle in Canada”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664820485302{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]

Applicants must also demonstrate that they possess enough funds to settle in Canada. These funds should cover living expenses for them and any dependents that will be coming to Canada with them.

The minimum funds required for different family sizes are shown below.

Total Family Members Coming to CanadaFunds Needed (CAD)
1$13,213
2$16,449
3$20,222
4$24,553
5$27,847
6$31,407
7$34,967
Each additional member$3,560
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Designated Organizations for Canada Start-Up Visa” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1664827001901{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878624491{margin-top: 20px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”]There are three types of designated organizations that qualify under this Canada Start-Up Visa Program.

  • Venture capital funds
  • Angel investor groups
  • Business incubators
[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Venture Capital Funds”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878706585{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The List of Venture Capital funds that qualified for the Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Entrepreneurship Development Institute (YEDI) VC Fund
  • Yaletown Venture Partners Inc.
  • Westcap Management Ltd.
  • Version One Ventures
  • Vanedge Capital Limited Partnership
  • Top Renergy Inc.
  • ScaleUp Venture Partners, Inc.
  • Relay Ventures
  • Real Ventures
  • PRIVEQ Capital Funds
  • Pangaea Ventures Ltd.
  • Nova Scotia Innovation Corporation (o/a Innovacorp)
  • Lumira Ventures
  • iNovia Capital Inc.
  • Innovation Platform Capital International LP
  • Impression Ventures
  • Golden Venture Partners Fund, LP
  • Extreme Venture Partners LLP
  • Celtic House Venture Partners
  • BDC Venture Capital
  • BCF Ventures
  • 7 Gate Ventures
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Angel Investor Groups”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878755661{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The list of Angel Investors for the Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Angel Investors Inc.
  • VANTEC Angel Network Inc.
  • TenX Angel Investors Inc.
  • Southeastern Ontario Angel Network
  • Oak Mason Investments Inc.
  • Keiretsu Forum Canada
  • Golden Triangle Angel Network
  • Ekagrata Inc.
  • Canadian International Angel Investors
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Accent-Color” title=”Business Incubators”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878781421{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]The List of Business Incubators for Canada Start-Up Visa Program:

  • York Entrepreneurship Development Institute
  • Waterloo Accelerator Centre
  • VIATEC
  • TSRV Canada Inc. (operating as Techstars Canada)
  • Toronto Business Development Centre (TBDC)
  • The DMZ at Ryerson University
  • Spring Activator
  • Spark Commercialization and Innovation Centre
  • Ryerson Futures Inc.
  • Real Investment Fund III L.P. o/a FounderFuel
  • Platform Calgary
  • North Forge Technology Exchange
  • NEXT Canada
  • Millworks Centre for Entrepreneurship
  • LaunchPad PEI Inc.
  • Launch Academy – Vancouver
  • LatAm Startups
  • Knowledge Park o/a Planet Hatch
  • Invest Ottawa
  • Interactive Niagara Media Cluster o/a Innovate Niagara
  • Innovacorp
  • Highline BETA Inc.
  • Genesis Centre
  • Food Processing Development Centre
  • Extreme Innovations
  • Empowered Startups Ltd.
  • Creative Destruction Lab
  • Biomedical Commercialization Canada Inc. (operating as Manitoba Technology Accelerator)
  • Alberta Agriculture and Forestry
    • Alacrity Foundation
    • Agrivalue Processing Business Incubator
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Application Process: Canada Start-Up Visa” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1664821912942{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664878931450{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”]

The application process for the Canada Startup visa program is straightforward. Applicants must first pitch their business idea to the designated organizations mentioned earlier. They must successfully convince them to support their venture. If a designated organization chooses to support the startup, it will send a commitment certificate to IRCC and the applicant a letter of support. Once all the eligibility has been met, applicants can complete a Startup Visa application and submit it.

The steps involved in the application process for Canada Start-Up Visa from India are:

[/vc_column_text][toggles style=”default” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 1: Fill Out the Canada Start-Up Visa Application Form”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664823680722{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • The Generic Application Form for Canada must be filled out
  • Complete all required fields on the form before clicking the “Validate” button
  • Include the barcode page in the printed application form once it has been validated
  • The form must be signed and dated
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Step 2: Gather All the Required Documents”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664823856837{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • Check the [IMM 5760] Document Checklist to ensure that all documents are gathered in the order specified
  • Put all necessary documents in a sealed envelope
  • Take a printout of the document checklist and sign it
  • Your application should include this document checklist as a cover page
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Accent-Color” title=”Step 3: Pay Start-Up Visa Application fees”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664824193045{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • The application fee includes processing fees for you and anyone you include on the application
  • The Right of Permanent Residence Fee (RPRF)
  • Fees for third-party services, such as medical exams, police certificates, and language tests
  • Biometrics fees
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Accent-Color” title=”Step 4: Submit Your Canada Start-Up Visa Application”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1664824359517{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}”]
  • Make sure your application is finished before submitting it.
  • Ensure that you have signed all documents.
  • Pay your processing fees and submit your application with receipts.
  • Include all relevant documentation

Place all paperwork in a 9×12 inches envelope, label it “startup visa,” and send it to the specified location.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Processing Times

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_column_text]

Processing times for Canada Start-Up Visa from India vary between 12 to 16 months. Note that securing a commitment certificate and a letter of support can take several months on its own. Applicants should plan their settlement in Canada with these processing times in mind.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Qualifying for Work Permits

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_column_text]

Applicants that have entered Canada and are awaiting their application decision can work if they possess a work permit. These work permits are vital for Indian entrepreneurs to start working in their startup businesses quickly.

Canada immigration provides short-term work permits for such applicants if they possess a commitment certificate from a designated organization. In addition to this, applicants must pay an employer compliance fee and intend to live in a province or territory outside Quebec.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”How ELAAR can help you?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1651216426087{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]We have qualified immigration consultants to assess applications for the Canada Startup Visa program and ensure the various requirements are met. Our team of professionals is led by Keshav Sharma, a regulated Canadian immigration consultant who possesses extensive business management and immigration experience.

Our experts can assess business proposals and offer expert guidance to improve the likelihood of receiving support from a designated organization as well as the entire application process until the final decision is rendered.
